channel.title: INall
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INall, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Social Security agrees to customer-service audit after Elizabeth Warren meets with commissioner
item.description: The Social Security Administration has come under fire for AI phone glitches, long call times and website outages.

item.title: Is Insecurity Sabotaging Your Relationship? Here's How To Tell
item.description: Do you always defer to your partner?

item.title: This Zodiac Sign Is The Most Independent Of All 12—Is It Yours?
item.description: They're just fine on their own.

item.title: No, of Course You Can't Actually Play the New Lego Game Boy
item.description: A promo video of the new brick-built Nintendo collaboration has some people confused as to what your $60 will buy you.

item.title: I'm A Celebrity Makeup Artist: Here's How To Blur Fine Lines With One Product

item.title: We asked readers how they prefer their Coca-Cola. Only 2.8% chose high-fructose corn syrup over cane sugar.
item.description: Coca-Cola will soon introduce a cane-sugar version in the U.S. as an alternative offering.

item.title: Zenbivy Light Bed Review: Still the Best Backcountry Sleep System
item.description: The revamped Zenbivy Light Bed still uses the company’s clever quilt-and-sheet sleeping system, but sheds some ounces for ultralight backpackers.

item.title: Snapchat will now let your friends know you’ve made it home safe
item.description: Snap Map's new "Home Safe" feature sends one-time alerts to friends, so you don't need to remember to message others that you're back safely.

item.title: Southwest unveils big credit card refresh: 50% fee hikes, but new seating and boarding perks
item.description: Southwest Airlines hiked annual fees on its credit cards, but also announced a host of new benefits and other changes.

item.title: Planning a city trip this summer? These IHG hotels will be your urban escape

item.title: Newly built homes are cheaper than previously owned homes as builders ramp up price cuts
